abstract:
A 74-year-old male patient complaining of crescendo TIAs, hypertension and hyperlipidaemia.
Duplex ultrasound scan MR angiography.
Pseudoaneurysm stemming from the ICA.
An open or endovascular procedure for the right pECCA repair, or a left CEA or CAS.
title: How should I treat concomitant post-endarterectomy carotid pseudoaneurysm and contralateral symptomatic stenosis?
